adjectives.description: mesomorphic (comparative more mesomorphic, superlative most mesomorphic)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to a mesomorph.
examples: For instance, compared to the typical ectomorphic or endomorphic child, the mesomorphic boy or girl may have more energy and a greater motivation for vigorous play with peers.

entries.meaning: (chemistry, physics) Of or pertaining to phases of matter intermediate between solid and liquid; of or pertaining to liquid crystals.
examples: Changes in the chemical constitution of a mesomorphic compound may therefore radically alter the mesomorphic properties and thermal stabilities.
